documentation.text:
Note that this function can be executed by anyone. Of course, only the highest bidder is expected to 
 be the interest party in executing it, but we allow anyone to operate it, since this was the intention of the auction.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "cannot transfer player to highest bidder until auction finishes"

arguments.value: cannot transfer player to highest bidder until auction finishes

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "cannot transfer player to highest bidder until auction finishes"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "the player in this auction was already transferred"

arguments.value: the player in this auction was already transferred

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "the player in this auction was already transferred"

arguments.value: false

documentation.text:
Note that this function can be executed by anyone. Of course, only the highest bidder is expected to 
 be the interest party in executing it, but we allow anyone to operate it, since this was the intention of the auction.

an asset is ready to be put for sale again if it either has never been assigned to an auction or, in case it has:
  - if the auction never received a bid
  - if the auction received bids, and the new owner finally executed the "receive asset" function.
 Note that the difference with isPlayerFrozenCrypto is that isAuctionSettled is a bit more restrictive, and triggered
 as soon as asset is putForSale. In contrast, isPlayerFrozenCrypto on triggers when first bid arrives.
this will check also for local crypto freeze of team when feature is added

 be the interest party in executing it, but we allow anyone to operate it, since this was the intention of the auction.

documentation.text:
Note that this function can be executed by anyone. Of course, only the highest bidder is expected to 
 be the interest party in executing it, but we allow anyone to operate it, since this was the intention of the auction.

an asset is ready to be put for sale again if it either has never been assigned to an auction or, in case it has:
  - if the auction never received a bid
  - if the auction received bids, and the new owner finally executed the "receive asset" function.
 Note that the difference with isPlayerFrozenCrypto is that isAuctionSettled is a bit more restrictive, and triggered
 as soon as asset is putForSale. In contrast, isPlayerFrozenCrypto on triggers when first bid arrives.
this will check also for local crypto freeze of team when feature is added

devdoc.author: Freeverse.io, www.freeverse.io
devdoc.details: There are therefore "Two Markets", one operated in Crypto and one in Fiat.Where necessary we make functions explicit, e.g. isPlayerFrozenInAnyMarket.
devdoc.title: Auctions operated in cryptocurrency, without anyone's permission (other than sellers and buyers)

executePlayerTransfer(uint256).notice: Note that this function can be executed by anyone. Of course, only the highest bidder is expected to  be the interest party in executing it, but we allow anyone to operate it, since this was the intention of the auction.

isAuctionSettled(uint256).notice: an asset is ready to be put for sale again if it either has never been assigned to an auction or, in case it has:  - if the auction never received a bid  - if the auction received bids, and the new owner finally executed the "receive asset" function. Note that the difference with isPlayerFrozenCrypto is that isAuctionSettled is a bit more restrictive, and triggered as soon as asset is putForSale. In contrast, isPlayerFrozenCrypto on triggers when first bid arrives.

isTeamFrozenInAnyMarket(uint256).notice: this will check also for local crypto freeze of team when feature is added

withdraw(uint256).notice: Note that this function can be executed by anyone. Of course, only the highest bidder is expected to  be the interest party in executing it, but we allow anyone to operate it, since this was the intention of the auction.
